p: Verbascosides, also known as actosides and caffeoylcalleryanins, are polyphenolic catechols. They have been isolated from multiple plant families, such as Bignoniaceae [ 43], Lamiaceae [ 160], Scrophulariaceae [ 161], and species such as Arrabidaea spp. and Cuspidaria pulchra (Cham.) L.G. Lohmann. These tropical plants have been used for medical purposes, such as the treatment of skin effects, leukemia, anemia, colic, and diarrhea, because of their anti-inflammatory and astringent effects [ 162].
